When I first saw this one, it was right in front of my face, hanging on single strand of silk attached to a tree at about 15 feet above the ground. After devouring the web that I had cut loose from the ground with my leaf blowing, the spider slowly made it's way up into the trees and eventually out of sight.
 
 
 http://i3.photobucket.com/albums/y86/jimstrucking/goldenspiderDec12007017.jpg
 
 
 http://i3.photobucket.com/albums/y86/jimstrucking/goldenspiderDec12007028.jpg
 
 
 http://i3.photobucket.com/albums/y86/jimstrucking/goldenspiderDec12007032.jpg

Could this be the spider in another season or cycle which would explain the difference in colors?
 
 http://www.insectimages.org/browse/detail.cfm?imgnum=0007060

or how about this one.
 
 http://www.insectimages.org/browse/detail.cfm?imgnum=5005098
 
 The abdomens of both seem too long when compared to your though.

I FOUND IT!!! I'm so excited, I went back and looked some more and I found it without question. It is called a Yellow Spider and here's the link with a good picture. It doesn't give much info on it though, but now that I know what kind it is that's easy enough to find.
 
 http://flickr.com/photos/jgriffinstewart/2050356418/
